alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 12:09PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nevada... Marys River Near Deeth affecting Elko County. .Warm daytime temperatures along with low temperatures remaining above freezing overnight will accelerate snow melt. River flows will increase gradually over the coming days, reaching flood stage by Sunday. For the Marys River...including Charleston, Charleston, Deeth... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Marys River Near Deeth. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.8 feet, Minor to moderate lowland flooding occurs on lower mary`s river, with flooding of many rural roads near the river. Some streets in deeth flood, as well as basements and foundations of a few homes. This is about 800 cfs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM PDT Friday the stage was 5.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Sunday morning and continue rising to 7.1 feet early Wednesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
